20101222162215.000|20101222162217.000|TR0|tell you, is much more of an art than a

20101222162225.000|20101222162228.000|TR0|necessarily their fault.  But if your

20101222162230.000|20101222162233.000|TR0|something more than a virus, or anything 
20101222162233.000|20101222162235.000|TR0|like that, you trust it, go with it.

20101222162248.000|20101222162250.000|TR0|COHEN:  Right.  As parents and as patients 
20101222162250.000|20101222162253.000|TR0|there is a bunch of different things that 
20101222162253.000|20101222162255.000|TR0|we can do to avoid being misdiagnosed.
20101222162255.000|20101222162258.000|TR0|

20101222164456.000|20101222164459.000|TR0|LANGFORD:  We don't know yet.  Out office 
20101222164459.000|20101222164501.000|TR0|of fire investigation is looking into it.  
20101222164501.000|20101222164504.000|TR0|But I can tell you the rear of the 
20101222164504.000|20101222164506.000|TR0|building was open and this time of year 
20101222164506.000|20101222164509.000|TR0|people, as we refer to them as squatters, 
20101222164509.000|20101222164511.000|TR0|people without a place to stay sometimes 
20101222164511.000|20101222164514.000|TR0|use vacant buildings. And sometimes they 
20101222164514.000|20101222164516.000|TR0|set small fires for heat and these fires 
20101222164516.000|20101222164519.000|TR0|sometimes get out of control.  That could 
20101222164519.000|20101222164521.000|TR0|have happened here.  We have no reason to
